cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: continues WNW today, slowing and turning NW Sun–Mon while crossing central/western Cuba, then expected to enter the Florida Straits and track northward just offshore or along Florida’s west coast toward the Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west-coast/Big Bend section (near or just north of Tampa–Cedar Key corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory 12
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory 12
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys northward along the entire west coast through the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Tue night–Wed
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along Tampa Bay and adjacent coastline if Elsa tracks close to shore
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher pockets; urban and low-area flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and rip currents; short-fuse tornado threat in outer rainbands
